title: Putin nuclear move 'dangerous' - Nato
desc: Nato condemns Russia's move to strengthen its nuclear arsenal after it says it will put more than 40 intercontinental ballistic missiles into service.

title: Trump to run for president in 2016
desc: Property billionaire Donald Trump announces he will run for the White House as a Republican in the 2016 election.

title: Chris Evans is new Top Gear presenter
desc: TV and radio personality Chris Evans will replace Jeremy Clarkson as the lead presenter of an all-new Top Gear line-up the BBC announces.

title: Rachel Dolezal: 'I identify as black'
desc: Rachel Dolezal the US race activist accused of pretending to be black refuses to back down and says she identifies as black.

title: Husbands appeal to 'Syria' family
desc: The husbands of three UK sisters feared to have travelled to Syria with their children say they miss and love them as they appeal for them to come home.

title: Six die in US balcony collapse
desc: The balcony of a fourth floor flat in Berkeley has collapsed killing several Irish young people and injuring several others at a 21st birthday party.

title: Top al-Qaeda commander confirmed dead
desc: Al-Qaeda confirms that a key commander - Nasser al-Wuhayshi who headed Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula - has been killed in a US drone strike in Yemen.

title: Las Vegas mogul Kirk Kerkorian dies
desc: Kirk Kerkorian the veteran US businessman who made billions in the hospitality and entertainment industries in Las Vegas dies at the age of 98.

title: Juncker: Greece 'misleading' voters
desc: Jean-Claude Juncker has accused the Greek government of misleading voters as Alexis Tsipras said its creditors were trying to humiliate the country.

title: Court upholds Morsi death sentence
desc: An Egyptian court upholds the death sentence imposed on ousted ex-President Mohammed Morsi over a mass jailbreak in 2011.

title: US orders ban on trans-fats
desc: Trans-fats are unsafe to eat and must be banned from the food supply within three years say US regulators.

title: EU ministers split on migrant quotas
desc: EU ministers fail to agree on a plan to relocate migrants as Italian police scuffle with a group on the French border.

title: VIDEO: Donald Trump to run for US presidency
desc: The businessman Donald Trump announces his plan to run for the US Presidency in the 2016 election.

title: VIDEO: 'Rachel Dolezal needs therapy'
desc: Ruthanne and Larry Dolezal the parents of US civil rights worker Rachel Dolezal have urged their daughter to seek help for ''personal identity issues''.

title: VIDEO: Michelle Obama greeted with cheers
desc: Michelle Obama has been greeted with cheers and applause as she arrived at Mulberry School for Girls in East London.

title: VIDEO: Migrants forcibly removed from border
desc: Italian police forcibly removed many people who had migrated from Africa who were attempting to cross the border into France.

title: VIDEO: Six students die in balcony collapse
desc: Six Irish students have been killed and seven others have been injured when a fourth-floor balcony in California collapsed.

title: VIDEO: Who are al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula?
desc: Middle East Analyst Alan Johnston takes a look back at the life of Nasser al-Wuhayshi who lived and died at the very centre of al-Qaeda.

title: VIDEO: Virtual reality 'to touch everybody'
desc: BBC technology correspondent Rory Cellan-Jones learns how virtual reality is set to touch all areas of people's lives.

title: VIDEO: Iraqi comedian satirises extremism
desc: A news anchor from Iraq Ahmed Albasheer describes how he switched to a comedy career to tackle corruption and extremism.

title: Why South Africa let Sudan's Bashir escape justice
desc: South Africa's president angered his own people but kept his African peers on side by letting Sudan's leader flee in defiance of the courts writes the BBC's Milton Nkosi.

title: EU solidarity damaged by splits on migrants and Greece
desc: EU member states may talk loudly about solidarity but scratch under the surface and they are all just pursuing their national interest.

title: At E3 virtual becomes real
desc: Rory Cellan-Jones tries some of the newest virtual reality technologies at the annual E3 conference.

title: Does killing militant leaders work?
desc: The West's whack-a-mole approach to counter-terrorism has gathered momentum but does it work asks Shiraz Maher.

title: Is Tal Abyad a turning point for Syria's Kurds?
desc: The capture of Tal Abyad from Islamic State (IS) by YPG fighters is a strategic gain for Syria's Kurds says Kurdish affairs analyst Cale Saleh.

title: Migrants: What can Europe achieve?
desc: Paul Adams looks at what's being discussed by EU ministers to tackle the ever-growing migrant problem.

title: Shape of Lego figures 'protected'
desc: An EU court rules that the shape of Lego's people figures is a protected trademark blocking a move by a rival company that wanted to copy them.

title: Raccoon pictured 'riding alligator'
desc: A man walking in a national forest in central Florida has captured a rare image of a raccoon appearing to ride on the back of an alligator.

title: Nestle to destroy noodles worth $50m
desc: Nestle says it will destroy more than $50m (Â£32m) worth of its hugely popular Maggi noodles following a ban imposed by India's food safety regulator.

title: UK inflation rate turns positive
desc: Transport costs including air fares helped the UK's CPI inflation rate to rise to 0.1% in May up from -0.1% in April official figures show.

title: Deus Ex game play footage unveiled
desc: The first footage from the upcoming Deus Ex: Mankind Divided video game has been unveiled at E3.

title: Nintendo & Activision tie-up on toys
desc: Nintendo has announced a deal with Activision to let its Amiibo toys be used in the Skylander series of games.

title: Depp: Lee was 'noble and gallant'
desc: Johnny Depp pays tribute to Sir Christopher Lee saying he was as noble and gallant as he was wise.

title: Sir John Hurt diagnosed with cancer
desc: Veteran actor Sir John Hurt says he has been diagnosed with cancer but is more than optimistic about his future.

title: Pope 'urges swift action' on climate
desc: Pope Francis will call for swift action to protect the Earth and fight global warming according to a leaked draft of the pontiff's encyclical.

title: Lake remembers Romania's revolution
desc: Sediment gathered from a lake in Romania reveals the environmental change linked to changes in the political landscape a study shows.

title: Blood chemical predicts brain decline
desc: Scientists discover a chemical in blood that indicates whether people will have declining brain function in the years to come.

title: South Korea begins Mers plasma trial
desc: South Korea begins trials of plasma therapy as the Mers death toll rises to 19.

title: Chelsea on verge of Falcao loan deal
desc: Chelsea are on the verge of agreeing a season-long loan deal for Colombian striker Radamel Falcao from Monaco.

title: Murray wins opening match at Queen's
desc: Andy Murray starts his grass-court season with a straight-sets win over qualifier Yen-Hsun Lu at Queen's Club.

title: How many Earths do we need?
desc: If everyone on the planet consumed as much as the average US citizen it's argued four Earths would be needed to sustain them. Really?

title: Do butterflies hold the answer to life's mysteries?
desc: Throughout history butterflies have been seen as symbols of many things - now though scientists study them to see what they can tell us about our changing planet.

title: Prince has 'secret' show for Obamas
desc: White House officials will not say whether pop star Prince performed at a weekend party at the executive residence despite guests posting about it on social media.

title: Are new Magaluf drinking laws working?
desc: Newsbeat spends the weekend in the Spanish holiday resort town of Magaluf to see whether the new drinking laws there are working.

title: US aid for anti-Boko Haram force
desc: The US says it will give $5m (Â£3.2m) towards a multi-national task force being set up to fight Boko Haram as it steps up cross-border attacks.

title: Hong Kong to debate divisive reforms
desc: Lawmakers in Hong Kong begin debating a controversial political reform package on Wednesday ahead of a much-anticipated vote later this week.

title: Teen jailed for German student death
desc: An eighteen year-old man is given three years in youth custody over the death of a German student teacher who was hailed as national hero.

title: US and Venezuela praise talks
desc: The United States and Venezuela both welcome talks held on Saturday between the two sides aimed at reducing diplomatic tensions.

title: Kurds deal IS 'biggest setback yet'
desc: Syrian Kurds say they are securing the border city of Tal Abyad after seizing it from IS in what activists say is the militants' biggest setback.

title: US baseball team accused of hacking
desc: The FBI is investigating St Louis Cardinals on charges the team hacked into the computers of a rival club.

title: Alton Towers victim 'feared death'
desc: A woman injured in a rollercoaster crash at Alton Towers speaks about the events for the first time saying she thought she was going to die.

title: Mother who gave away baby jailed
desc: A mother who tricked her former partner into thinking she had an abortion so she could give his baby to her gay friend is jailed.

title: Hillsborough dad tried to save girls
desc: A father who lost two daughters at the Hillsborough disaster describes how he gave them mouth-to-mouth resuscitation.

desc: The government moves to try to head off Conservative rebellions over the timing of a EU referendum and the rules for a future campaign.
